Author: lupin_sansei
Content:
"Carlson's lawyer Todd Schneider said the lawsuit was "about changing the landscape and making a statement out there that gay people, just like heterosexuals, have the right and desire to meet other people with whom they can fall in love.""

But you don't have the right to force a private web site to achieve that task for you, do you?

Author: brlewis
Content:
No, not joking.

Here are some people who might have upmodded me:

http://web.mit.edu/committees/couhes/

Author: lupin_sansei
Content: There's some ways to get megs of storage on the client using Flash and other things (http://www.niallkennedy.com/blog/archives/2007/01/ajax-performance-local-storage.html) to store a few megs of content locally. I wonder why they didn't go with that, in order to avoid the plugin?

Author: staunch
Content: I like it. It's the kind of database I'm sure some investors already maintain internally. It's neat someone is creating an open site like this. It doesn't accept user contributions though, which seems like an obvious mistake.

Title: eHarmony sued in California for excluding gays

Author: jamiequint
Content:
Oh, I don't think his attitude was appropriate, but his point was justified.

I'm still not sure what you're trying to say about the Rails framework in general, I've never had an issue using it, or contributing to it.

Author: lupin_sansei
Content: If they provide offline support for Gmail ir Google Maps it might be the killer app to get Google Gears used widely.
